meanings.definition: The quality of being wise or having good judgment.
meanings.sent1: Her sapience was evident in the way she always knew the right thing to do.
meanings.sent2: His sapience guided him to make the best choice in a difficult situation.
meanings.sent3: Despite his young age, his sapience shone through in his thoughtful actions.
meanings.sent4: The old tree seemed to possess a sense of sapience, standing tall and weathering many storms.
meanings.sent5: In the fable, the owl was portrayed as the symbol of sapience, always offering sage advice.

meanings.definition: The ability to make sound decisions based on knowledge and experience.
meanings.sent1: The professor's sapience in the field of history was unmatched by his peers.
meanings.sent2: With his sapience, he navigated through the complex maze of information effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The robot's artificial sapience led it to choose the most efficient route every time.
meanings.sent4: In the world of chess, the grandmaster's sapience was akin to seeing several moves ahead.
meanings.sent5: The wise elder shared his sapience with the younger generation, passing down valuable lessons.
